title: Edward Teller: Giant of the Golden Age of Physics
description: 1990 Charles Scribner hardcover, Stanley A. Blumberg (Energy and Conflict), Louis G. Panos. Known as father of the American H-Bomb, Teller continues to play a crucial role in U.S. nuclear weapons policy. Born a Hungarian Jew in 1908, the young physicist studied with such greats as Werner Heisenberg and Niels Bohr. Fleeing Nazism, he became a member of the Manhattan Project team which developed the world's first atomic bomb.
author: Stanley A. Blumberg
